meanings.definition: To exceed in weight, value, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The elephant outbalances the mouse in size.
meanings.sent2: In this competition, skill outbalances luck.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant outbalances the huge watermelon in a seesaw game.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outbalances any material possessions.
meanings.sent5: The impact of his words outbalances the silence in the room.

meanings.definition: To be more significant or influential than something else.
meanings.sent1: His experience outbalances his lack of formal education.
meanings.sent2: In this debate, logic outbalances emotions.
meanings.sent3: The student's excuse of 'the dog ate my homework' outbalances all other excuses.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of nature outbalances any man-made creation.
meanings.sent5: Her determination outbalances any obstacles in her path.
